reviews.text: Came here for a late dinner around 9pm. The food was delicious overall. The cabbage had strong wok hei, though it could use a bit more sauce. Still, a satisfying meal and would come back again!

Had a nice meal at New Taste and it was great! Ambiance was good, they have a trendy design that makes the dining experience elevated. Had their spicy grilled fish and was pleasantly satisfied with it, will definitely recommend and go back for more. ðŸ‘ŒðŸ‘ŒðŸ‘Œ

It was a delightful experience for a quick and convenient lunch fix. The dishes, especially the spicy cold chicken, noodles, and soup, were flavorful and carried the authentic Sichuan taste. The balance of spices and the texture of the noodles were impressive.

The ambiance is casual and comfortable, perfect for a no-fuss meal. Itâ€™s great for anyone looking for a satisfying meal with a kick of spice. Iâ€™d definitely consider returning when Iâ€™m in the area. A solid option for Sichuan cuisine lovers!

Great value-for-money spot in Boon Keng! The grilled fish is generous in portion and super flavourful only at $14.40â€“ perfect for sharing. Love the $1.99 side dish add-on when you hit the minimum spend, and their traditional barley drink is a must-try.

Trying the çƒ¤é±¼ for the first time and we loved it. The portion is huge and the fish is so tender with lots of other ingredients, we could barely finish it. We liked it that the soup is not too salty but just nice.

I come here often to eat their tomato egg, cabbage and more.
